    • Constructor Detail

      • EncapsulatedGraph

        public EncapsulatedGraph(java.lang.String yourName)
        Create a new graph that will communicate with my server. Specify your name, to identify your score and your path.
        Parameters:
        yourName - The name you wish to attribute to your path

    • Method Detail

      • getCurrentNode

        public org.graphstream.graph.Node getCurrentNode()
        The most important piece of encapsulated graph state is the current node, upon which a `searcher' currently exists.
        Returns:
        The current node

      • edgesOfCurrentNode

        public java.util.ArrayList<org.graphstream.graph.Edge> edgesOfCurrentNode()
        Gets the edges associated with the current node
        Returns:
        The edges of the current node

      • moveToNewNode

        public boolean moveToNewNode(org.graphstream.graph.Node node)
        Move the `pointer' within the encapsulated graph to a new node. This will cause you to have the cost of that edge attributed to you. Search wisely! If you attempt to move to a node that is not connected to the current node this method will return false.
        Parameters:
        node - The node to move to
        Returns:
        Whether the move was successful or not.

      • found

        public boolean found()
        Whether the desired object, hidden within this graph, has been found.
        Returns:
        Whether the object has been found

      • getPath

        public java.util.ArrayList<org.graphstream.graph.Node> getPath()
        Get the path you have created so far with your search.
        Returns:
        The path created

      • sendPath

        public void sendPath()
        Upload your path to the server for scoring!
